  16. ‌#define CAML_INTERNALS

  18. /* Operations on objects */

  20. #include <string.h>
  21. #include "caml/camlatomic.h"
  22. #include "caml/alloc.h"
  23. #include "caml/fail.h"
  24. #include "caml/gc.h"
  25. #include "caml/interp.h"
  26. #include "caml/major_gc.h"
  27. #include "caml/memory.h"
  28. #include "caml/minor_gc.h"
  29. #include "caml/misc.h"

  35. ‌static int obj_tag (value arg)
  36. {
  37.   header_t hd;

  39.   if (Is_long (arg)) {
  40.     return 1000;   /* int_tag */
  41.   } else if ((long) arg & (sizeof (value) - 1)) {
  42.     return 1002;   /* unaligned_tag */
  43.   } else {
  44.     /* The acquire load ensures that reading the field of a Forward_tag
  45.        block in stdlib/camlinternalLazy.ml:force_gen has the necessary
  46.        synchronization. */
  47.     hd = (header_t)atomic_load_acquire(Hp_atomic_val(arg));
  48.     return Tag_hd(hd);
  49.   }
  50. }

  52. ‌CAMLprim value caml_obj_tag(value arg)
  53. {
  54.   return Val_int (obj_tag(arg));
  55. }

  57. ‌CAMLprim value caml_obj_raw_field(value arg, value pos)
  58. {
  59.   /* Represent field contents as a native integer */
  60.   return caml_copy_nativeint((intnat) Field(arg, Long_val(pos)));
  61. }

  63. ‌CAMLprim value caml_obj_set_raw_field(value arg, value pos, value bits)
  64. {
  65.   Field(arg, Long_val(pos)) = (value) Nativeint_val(bits);
  66.   return Val_unit;
  67. }

  69. /* [size] is a value encoding a number of blocks */
  70. ‌CAMLprim value caml_obj_block(value tag, value size)
  71. {
  72.   value res;
  73.   mlsize_t sz;
  74.   tag_t tg;

  76.   sz = Long_val(size);
  77.   tg = Long_val(tag);

  79.   /* When [tg < No_scan_tag], [caml_alloc] returns an object whose fields are
  80.    * initialised to [Val_unit]. Otherwise, the fields are uninitialised. We aim
  81.    * to avoid inconsistent states in other cases, on a best-effort basis --
  82.    * by default there is no initialization. */
  83.   switch (tg) {
  84.   default: {
  85.       res = caml_alloc(sz, tg);
  86.       break;
  87.   }
  88.   case Abstract_tag:
  89.   case Double_tag:
  90.   case Double_array_tag: {
  91.     /* In these cases, the initial content is irrelevant,
  92.        no specific initialization needed. */
  93.     res = caml_alloc(sz, tg);
  94.     break;
  95.   }
  96.   case Closure_tag: {
  97.     /* [Closure_tag] is below [no_scan_tag], but closures have more
  98.        structure with in particular a "closure information" that
  99.        indicates where the environment starts. We initialize this to
  100.        a sane value, as it may be accessed by runtime functions. */
  101.     /* Closinfo_val is the second field, so we need size at least 2 */
  102.     if (sz < 2) caml_invalid_argument ("Obj.new_block");
  103.     res = caml_alloc(sz, tg);
  104.     Closinfo_val(res) = Make_closinfo(0, 2); /* does not allocate */
  105.     break;
  106.   }
  107.   case String_tag: {
  108.     /* For [String_tag], the initial content does not matter. However,
  109.        the length of the string is encoded using the last byte of the
  110.        block. For this reason, the blocks with [String_tag] cannot be
  111.        of size [0]. We initialise the last byte to [0] such that the
  112.        length returned by [String.length] and [Bytes.length] is
  113.        a non-negative number. */
  114.     if (sz == 0) caml_invalid_argument ("Obj.new_block");
  115.     res = caml_alloc(sz, tg);
  116.     Field (res, sz - 1) = 0;
  117.     break;
  118.   }
  119.   case Custom_tag: {
  120.     /* It is difficult to correctly use custom objects allocated
  121.        through [Obj.new_block], so we disallow it completely. The
  122.        first field of a custom object must contain a valid pointer to
  123.        a block of custom operations. Without initialisation, hashing,
  124.        finalising or serialising this custom object will lead to
  125.        crashes.  See #9513 for more details. */
  126.     caml_invalid_argument ("Obj.new_block");
  127.   }
  128.   }

  130.   return res;
  131. }

  133. ‌CAMLprim value caml_obj_with_tag(value new_tag_v, value arg)
  134. {
  135.   CAMLparam2 (new_tag_v, arg);
  136.   CAMLlocal1 (res);
  137.   mlsize_t sz, i;
  138.   tag_t tg;

  140.   sz = Wosize_val(arg);
  141.   tg = (tag_t)Long_val(new_tag_v);
  142.   if (sz == 0) CAMLreturn (Atom(tg));
  143.   if (tg >= No_scan_tag) {
  144.     res = caml_alloc(sz, tg);
  145.     memcpy(Bp_val(res), Bp_val(arg), sz * sizeof(value));
  146.   } else if (sz <= Max_young_wosize) {
  147.     res = caml_alloc_small(sz, tg);
  148.     for (i = 0; i < sz; i++) Field(res, i) = Field(arg, i);
  149.   } else {
  150.     res = caml_alloc_shr(sz, tg);
  151.     /* It is safe to use [caml_initialize] even if [tag == Closure_tag]
  152.        and some of the "values" being copied are actually code pointers.
  153.        That's because the new "value" does not point to the minor heap. */
  154.     for (i = 0; i < sz; i++) caml_initialize(&Field(res, i), Field(arg, i));
  155.     /* Give gc a chance to run, and run memprof callbacks */
  156.     caml_process_pending_actions();
  157.   }

  159.   CAMLreturn (res);
  160. }

  162. ‌CAMLprim value caml_obj_dup(value arg)
  163. {
  164.   return caml_obj_with_tag(Val_long(Tag_val(arg)), arg);
  165. }

  167. ‌CAMLprim value caml_obj_add_offset (value v, value offset)
  168. {
  169.   return v + (unsigned long) Int32_val (offset);
  170. }

  172. ‌CAMLprim value caml_obj_compare_and_swap (value v, value f,
  173.                                           value oldv, value newv)
  174. {
  175.   int res = caml_atomic_cas_field(v, Int_val(f), oldv, newv);
  176.   caml_check_urgent_gc(Val_unit);
  177.   return Val_int(res);
  178. }

  180. ‌CAMLprim value caml_obj_is_shared (value obj)
  181. {
  182.   return Val_int(Is_long(obj) || !Is_young(obj));
  183. }

  185. /* The following functions are used to support lazy values. They are not
  186. * written in OCaml in order to ensure atomicity guarantees with respect to the
  187. * GC. */
  188. ‌CAMLprim value caml_lazy_make_forward (value v)
  189. {
  190.   CAMLparam1 (v);
  191.   CAMLlocal1 (res);

  193.   res = caml_alloc_small (1, Forward_tag);
  194.   Field (res, 0) = v;
  195.   CAMLreturn (res);
  196. }

  198. ‌static int obj_update_tag (value blk, int old_tag, int new_tag)
  199. {
  200.   header_t hd;
  201.   tag_t tag;

  203.   SPIN_WAIT {
  204.     hd = Hd_val(blk);
  205.     tag = Tag_hd(hd);

  207.     if (tag != old_tag) return 0;
  208.     if (caml_domain_alone()) {
  209.       Unsafe_store_tag_val(blk, new_tag);
  210.       return 1;
  211.     }

  213.     if (atomic_compare_exchange_strong(Hp_atomic_val(blk), &hd,
  214.                                        Hd_with_tag(hd, new_tag)))
  215.       return 1;
  216.   }
  217. }

  219. ‌CAMLprim value caml_lazy_reset_to_lazy (value v)
  220. {
  221.   CAMLassert (Tag_val(v) == Forcing_tag);

  223.   obj_update_tag (v, Forcing_tag, Lazy_tag);
  224.   return Val_unit;
  225. }

  227. ‌CAMLprim value caml_lazy_update_to_forward (value v)
  228. {
  229.   CAMLassert (Tag_val(v) == Forcing_tag);

  231.   obj_update_tag (v, Forcing_tag, Forward_tag);
  232.   return Val_unit;
  233. }

  235. ‌CAMLprim value caml_lazy_read_result (value v)
  236. {
  237.   if (obj_tag(v) == Forward_tag)
  238.     return Field(v,0);
  239.   return v;
  240. }

  242. ‌CAMLprim value caml_lazy_update_to_forcing (value v)
  243. {
  244.   if (Is_block(v) && /* Needed to ensure that we don't attempt to update the
  245.                         header of a integer value */
  246.       obj_update_tag (v, Lazy_tag, Forcing_tag)) {
  247.     return Val_int(0);
  248.   } else {
  249.     return Val_int(1);
  250.   }
  251. }

  253. /* For mlvalues.h and camlinternalOO.ml
  254.    See also GETPUBMET in interp.c
  255. */

  257. ‌CAMLprim value caml_get_public_method (value obj, value tag)
  258. {
  259.   value meths = Field (obj, 0);
  260.   int li = 3, hi = Field(meths,0), mi;
  261.   while (li < hi) {
  262.     mi = ((li+hi) >> 1) | 1;
  263.     if (tag < Field(meths,mi)) hi = mi-2;
  264.     else li = mi;
  265.   }
  266.   /* return 0 if tag is not there */
  267.   return (tag == Field(meths,li) ? Field (meths, li-1) : 0);
  268. }

  270. /* Allocate OO ids in chunks, to avoid contention */
  271. ‌#define Id_chunk 1024

  273. ‌static atomic_uintnat oo_next_id;

  275. ‌CAMLprim value caml_fresh_oo_id (value v) {
  276.   if (Caml_state->oo_next_id_local % Id_chunk == 0) {
  277.     Caml_state->oo_next_id_local =
  278.       atomic_fetch_add(&oo_next_id, Id_chunk);
  279.   }
  280.   v = Val_long(Caml_state->oo_next_id_local++);
  281.   return v;
  282. }

  284. ‌CAMLprim value caml_set_oo_id (value obj) {
  285.   value v = Val_unit;
  286.   Field(obj, 1) = caml_fresh_oo_id(v);
  287.   return obj;
  288. }

  290. ‌CAMLprim value caml_int_as_pointer (value n) {
  291.   return n - 1;
  292. }

  294. /* Compute how many words in the heap are occupied by blocks accessible
  295.    from a given value */

  297. ‌#define ENTRIES_PER_QUEUE_CHUNK 4096
  298. ‌struct queue_chunk {
  299.   struct queue_chunk *next;
  300.   value entries[ENTRIES_PER_QUEUE_CHUNK];
  301. };
